content: The Excellence of Wisdom
And understanding lift up her voice?
She takes her stand on the top of the high hill,
Beside the way, where the paths meet.
She cries out by the gates, at the entry of the city,
At the entrance of the doors:
â€œTo you, O men, I call,
And my voice  to the sons of men.
O you simple ones, understand prudence,
And you fools, be of an understanding heart.
Listen, for I will speak of excellent things,
And from the opening of my lips  right things;
For my mouth will speak truth;
Wickedness  an abomination to my lips.
All the words of my mouth  with righteousness;
Nothing crooked or perverse  in them.
They  all plain to him who understands,
And right to those who find knowledge.
Receive my instruction, and not silver,
And knowledge rather than choice gold;
For wisdom  better than rubies,
And all the things one may desire cannot be compared with her.
